description: The `test` method in `RegistrationController` is an empty method that serves no purpose. It adds clutter to the controller and violates the single responsibility principle.
The `store` method in `RegistrationController` has a hardcoded redirect to `/home`. This makes the application less flexible and harder to maintain.
guide: Use a named route for the redirect. For example, `return redirect()->route('home');`. This will make the application more flexible and easier to maintain.

description: The `RegistrationController` is responsible for validation, creating the user, and logging the user in. This violates the single responsibility principle and makes the controller harder to test.
guide: Create a `RegistrationService` that is responsible for creating the user and logging them in. The controller should then call the service. This will make the controller thinner and easier to test.

issue: No explicit API resource is used
description: The `RegistrationController` is returning a redirect. This is not ideal for API routes. It's better to return a JSON response with the user data.
guide: Use an API resource to return the user data. This will make the API more consistent and easier to consume.

description: The catch-all route `Route::get('/{any}', ...)` will catch any GET request that doesn't match a previous route. This can make it difficult to debug 404 errors and can also have performance implications.
guide: Be more specific with routes. If this is for an SPA, consider prefixing the API routes with `/api` and the web routes with something else. This will make the application more maintainable.

description: The route `Route::post('/dashboard', [RegistrationController::class, 'dashboard'])->name('home');` is pointing to a non-existent method and has an inconsistent name.
guide: Create a `DashboardController` with an `index` method. The route should then be `Route::get('/dashboard', [DashboardController::class, 'index'])->name('dashboard');`. The `home` name is already used for the redirect in the `RegistrationController`, so it should be changed to `dashboard`.
